headline: Pumpkin Bread
description: This bread actually tastes better after being frozen. I make a dozen batches in September and give them as Christmas gifts.
name: Pumpkin Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two loaf pans.
In a medium mixing bowl, combine flour, baking soda, salt, baking powder, nutmeg, allspice, cinnamon and cloves.

In a large bowl with an electric mixer, blend sugar, oil and eggs. Stir in pumpkin. Slowly blend the flour mixture into pumpkin mixture. While blending the mixture add water incrementally. Pour the batter into two prepared loaf pans.
Bake in a preheated 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) oven for 90 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pans.

review.reviewBody: Excellent bread! Moist & tasty! I used fresh baked pumpkin instead of canned. I also added vanilla and was a little heavy on the spices because I didn't have any cloves. I also did half white/brown sugar and added walnuts to one loaf. Nuts or not, this bread is a definite winner! Thanks for sharing.

This is my "go to recipe" for Pumpkin Bread - my granddaughter asks me to bake it about every month or so... the only thing I do different, is I use Avocado Oil or Light Olive Oil... those are the oils I have one hand. Everything else is perfect!!! I have printed several copies of this as I never want to lose it... The author is right, it's even better after it is frozen. I give one loaf to my granddaughter and cut the over loaf in half and freeze it and we eat one half... I make it so often this works for us. I suggest you give a copy of the recipe with it if you give it as a gift, save yourself sometime... LOL

I made a few healthier exchanges and my kids loved it! I substituted 1 1/2 c. cups of the regular flour for almond flour. I also replaced 1 of the cups of sugar with 1 cup of chopped raisins with boiling water poured over the top of the raisins in the measuring cup and let sit for 5 minutes. I also added 1 c. of salted pumpkin seeds. Very flavorful! We will make these muffins again.
This was the best pumpkin bread! I made it in small disposable pans to give to people at my church. It was so moist and delicious! Will definitely make again!
Really good. The mixture of spices was great I thought.

This is a simple recipe that came out great. The only thing I changed; based on previous reviews; was to add 1/2 teaspn maple extract, 1/2 teaspn vanilla extract and 1/2 cup of crushed black walnuts. These few tweaks produced a really flavorful bread.
I also made one loaf and reduced sugar to 1 cup.

I love this pumpkin bread. I use coconut oil instead of canola and heap the spices. I also use 3 medium sized loaf pans instead of 2 standard size which reduces baking time to between 50 minutes and an hour.
Am making this recipe for the third time...my husband absolutely devours it just about as fast as I can make it. He has always loved pumpkin bread and thinks this is the best ever!
Good recipe but I did NOT need to bake it for 90 mins as recipe states. 60-75 was plenty

First time making pumpkin bread and it turned out great! I read others reviews and I used brown sugar instead of white. DEFINITELY do 30 mins in oven uncovered and then 20 mins covered with tinfoil. At 30 mins my bread was cooked on the outside but raw inside, so I covered it and left it for 20 mins and it came out perfect and moist. This recipe made 2 loaves and I put one in the freezer.
It was AMAZING!!! My family and I absolutely loved it and I plan on making it tons more!!!

I made this recipe last week, absolutely wonderful. Nothing added, followed the recipe to a T, although I will be making it again soon (amazing how quickly two loaves disappear) and will add some roasted chopped walnuts. Next time I'll add a photo.

This bread came out perfectly. I made it exactly as is. No changes and cooked for the exact time. It's a winner. I was a little nervous based on other comments about flat flavor, etc. but perfect just the way it is.
It was lovely , can't have enough of it
Made according to recipe. Had to cook it less time but it turned out great

I LOVE this pumpkin bread. It has been a lot of years since I had this so I don't know if this is the pumpkin bread of my childhood or not, but don't really care. I make it as close to the recipe as I can living where there is no canned pumpkin and I don't remember how it was. I don't add the water because I'm afraid it will make the batter to runny , though today I'm hoping it isn't to thick. I made it at Christmas and everyone is still talking about it. I do up the spices as a personal preference. When I made it to give away to people the first time I didn't up the spices; now I know people here like a lot of spice, so I have.
Delicious!
No changes. Very moist and wouldn’t change anything.

Made exactly as directed and it turned out good. It is true that after freezing and thawing, it has even more flavor. This recipe is simple and easy to make, and for me it worked out and seemed to please the family.

Fantastic. I used self rising flour one omitted leavening and salt. I used equivalent amount of pumpkin pie spice instead of measuring assorted. I used white and brown sugar and maple syrup. I baked for less time and used a toothpick and a thermometer to test for doneness. I didn't want it to burn. I'm very happy with the result.
Easy to make and came out perfect the first time. The choice of pumpkin makes a huge difference. Try a few brands and stick with the one that you like the best.
i will not make it again. It is too much for me. But it was tasty...

I took the suggestion of another reviewer and doubled the pumpkin, leaving out the water and vanilla. This recipe made 24 very full muffins. I added a basic streusel topping with some chopped pumpkin seeds thrown in. Baked at 350 for about 25-30 minutes. My friend who loves pumpkin anything said these were the best pumpkin muffins she's ever had.
I thought it came out too dry. I should've added more raisins, and perhaps more pumpkin?
I added extra pumpkin. Otherwise, good receipe.
Bread was soft and crusty top. Delicious with tea

used only 1 cup of sugar and used more pumpkin instead of water. forgot to add nuts. delicious.
2nd version- still only one cup sugar but added 1/2 cup if chopped dried figs that were soaked in the water that i heated for 1 minute in the microwave. added 1 cup of walnuts. very tasty.
version 3- only 1 cup sugar and 1 teas of salt, add 1/2 cup of mini chocolate chips
I have been able to use this recipe and swap out the pumpkin for zucchini. Peel the zucchini and blend it with the 2/3 cup of water for the puree. Super good

I put the batter into the loaf pan and put it in the oven, and left to do something else for 90 mins. Came back, and the loaf was burnt. The now "crust" was almost black, but when I cut it open, tearing away the outer layer, it was steaming and the bread was at the perfect texture. Shoulda covered the pan in aluminum foil as the tip said. Tearing away the "crust", it still tasted delicious though.

I have made this exactly as written many times. It is good. However, I now use it as a base recipe. I add walnuts, cut the sugar to 2 cups, add vanilla, add more cinnamon, and add a teaspoon of cardamom. My rating is based on original recipe.
I made this exactly as the recipe called for and it turned out perfect. Will definitely make again and will add some pecans. Love it! This recipe will make 7 mini loaves. Cook for about 35 minutes.

Delicious. But had a problem with the batter not being fully cooked at the bottom, even after 95 minutes. It was close, but a quarter inch seemed stodgy on the bottom. Perhaps I put too many raisins in it.
Very nice recipe...the loaves rise up high and are very full. I added chocolate chips for fun. Make sure to grease the pans well.
Delicious!
Perfect recipe;)
I followed the recipe. Then realized I had no nutmeg or allspice. But it turned out deliciously. Moist ad spicy. We enjoyed it after watching our towns Christmas parade.

I used half of he butter instead of oil, then used a half of a cup of apple sauce and apple butter mixed. Did 1/3 wheat flour. Also added one cup of chocolate chips. The recipe is very moist! Very pleased with how it turned out. Works for muffins too!

I cut recipe in half to only make 10 servings. I used only 1 cup of sugar and between 1/3 and 1/2 cup of oil. I also added 1/4 c of chopped pecans. The bread cooked for about 40 minutes and came out moist and perfect. It’s sweet but not too sweet. Just how I like it.
This recipe is great wouldn’t change a thing family loves it putting it on my Christmas list of baking items thank you for the delicious recipe
It looks like you didn't add all the ingredients. Your's looks like it has maybe raisens in it, but none are added. Are those raisens or chocolate chips?
Delicious pumpkin bread. Perfect recipe, wouldn’t change a thing!

Absolutely wonderful pumpkin bread! I did as many other reviewers and split the sugar between brown and granulated. I also decreased the sugar a bit. Added some chopped walnuts and 1/2 cup chocolate chips. One of the moistest quick breads I've ever made.
My son loves this pumpkin bread and asks me to bake it every week. So it's been a weekly staple all fall! Great recipe.
Outstanding! However be sure not to overfill your loaf pan.

I had 3 cups of fresh pumpkin so I made one and a half of this recipe. I used part apple sauce and part oil and made 3 loafs, 6 muffins and 2 mini loafs. Turned out grand! If I don’t freeze them now they certainly won’t make it past the evening. My husband has been hovering around the kitchen sniffing the air.
Super easy to make. Took me less than 15 minutes to gather it all and get it mixed together. Also.. I used homemade pumpkin puree and so cut down the water. Will update upon tasting! ??
i used 1/2 to one cup of apple sauce. Into 2 loaf pans. to make squash bread moister.
baked for 60 mins. Perfect!

9-5-2018 ~Over many years of baking I’ve come to know that pumpkin bread recipes are all very much alike. Where they vary, generally, are with add-ins, which can of course be done with any pumpkin bread recipe, or with spices. Some call for quite a lot, some not much at all. The amount and blend of spices with this recipe was just right for me. Warm and aromatic and just plain pleasant, this is ideally spiced. Just for grins, I added a cup and a half of raisins. Nice. (Note: for simplicity’s sake, use a 15 oz. can of pumpkin rather than measuring out two cups)
Made it to exact recipe tastes and looks awesome!
ive made this three time now and it is usually gone in 24 hours everyone in my family loves it
Delicious but only needed one-half cup canola oil. I'll make this again for sure!
Moist and delicious
I used Krusteaz Gluten Free Flour and fresh pumpkin and it was AMAZING!! No picture because it was eaten so fast.
It didn't last one day. Excellent.
This is a nice moist loaf. I added walnuts and both golden and dark raisins. Next time I would double the spices.

I have made many pumpkin breads as this was by far the tastiest I have ever tried! The inside is moist while the outside is sweet and crispy. Mine only cooked for 75 minutes and any longer would have been too long.
3 Times delish
I added walnuts. My husband LOVED it. Will definately make again. Easy to make. I cooked faster than the recipe said though.
I just added apple sauce instead of oil same amount as ask for oil . turned out less heavy really good. this recipe made 4 7x8 bread tins . Great recipe
I LOVE this recipe. Super moist bread! Even after freezing a loaf and thawing it, the bread is still moist and incredibly delicious. I’m definitely making more!

Delicious recipe. A couple of changes; I didn't have canola oil so I used coconut oil. Also didn't realize I had sweet potato puree ,so I used that and a can of pumpkin. Mostly sweet potato. Still and all, as a pumpkin bread, Im sure it still would have been awesome! Hope this is helpful. Its always good to improvise too!

I enjoyed this recipe! It was a little bland, so I suggest eating this pumpkin bread with butter. I also suggest using flour to help the loaves come out of the pan after baking, instead of using aluminum foil. I used mini loaves and it worked really well! Great for fall and Halloween!
very good bread,was very sweet. big hit with grand kids.
I have made this several times now and it is so so good!!!
Delicious! I followed the recipe just as it was written and my student loved it!

I made it with 1 cup of brown sugar and 2 cups white sugar and I used 1/2 cup of applesauce with 1/2 cup oil and it was delicious. I'm sure the original is great but if you want to make these substitutions you should be quite happy.

I have used this recipe a few times.always comes out great even when I forget the water! I have used an assortment of different pumpkins all have worked well. Going to take the suggestion and make some ahead for Christmas!

I have made this recipe several times. I would recommend using 3 loaf pans and 1 mini loaf pan. 2 pans is incorrect. Also the baking time is only 60 minutes not 90 minutes. Other than that it's perfect!
Delicious, moist, and perfectly pumpkin. Try adding nuts and maple extract for a change up.
I made no changes to the recipe and will definitely make it again. Delicious!
Excellent pumpkin bread!
Sooo good! I made 6 of them and give it away as gifts, everyone loooved it! Great recipe, Thank you for sharing. I will definitely make more

Great recipe! Used homemade applesauce instead of oil & added some walnuts. Delicious, moist, my favorite pumpkin bread recipe. Even my husband, who doesn't usually care for pumpkin, raved about it. Thanks everyone for this keeper!

My go to pumpkin bread recipe. It makes about 2.5 loaves in the pans I have so I just make an extra mini loaf and it's perfect. I've made this recipe halved too. I've also made variations with different combos of walnuts, cranberries, and semi sweet chocolate chips. A+ every time!

I made this recipe with a few of the suggested changes. I used applesauce instead of oil, though I did add 2 TBSP OF olive oil. I added vanilla extract, valence orange peel, increased the cinnamon to 1 TBSP, and rather than do the ingredients separately, just added everything to one large bowl and mixed. I also added about a cup of chopped pecans. It turned out amazing and made 2 loafs. Be sure to check it after an hour and then lightly cover with foil to prevent over browning.

This bread is delicious, however, I could not give it 5 stars, because I changed it as per some reviewers ideas. I cut the sugar back to 1 c. white and 1 c. brown, doubled all of the spices (except the cloves), threw in 1/2 tsp. of powdered ginger and also 1/2 cup of fancy molasses with the wet ingredients (I like the dark rich colour). After all my tampering with this, the batter seemed very light and moist, so didn't use all of the water suggested. I got three medium sized loaves and they only took about 50 minutes to bake. Yumm - spicey and moist.

Made it as the recipe stated. It was good and moist. Not the most amazing thing ever, but certainly good and good enough to take to parties or give as gifts. The batter was more than 2 loaves so I filled 2 mini loaves as well.
I made this it was great.
Absolutely THE BEST...This is superlative and I will use this recipe forever!!! I added lots of pecans!! Simply THE BEST!!
Super moist! Excellent recipe.
Not enough pumpkin flavor
Very moist. Followed all the ingredients, but I do add a lot more cinnamon and all spice to really make it more flavorful. I feel that lots of pink in breads lack that pumpkin spiced taste .
I used fresh pumpkin and cut the liquid in half. I am able to make two large loaves and four mini loaves with this recipe. I also don't bake it quite as long, 45-50 minutes. The family loves it.
Very good, no changes, I will make it again!!!
I've read a lot of changes to the recipe but I roll 100% as is and it is one of our absolute family favorites!!!! Thanks!!!
Very good!!
Great! I Won first place in the state fair with this recipe!

Awesome, easy to follow recipe! I baked mine for one hour and that was plenty, any longer and it would burn. Used one medium loaf pan and a 8x8 square inch silicon mold. The flavor is nice! Surprisingly you can taste all the spices. I was skeptical about the spices and thought I should add more but I'm glad I didn't because it came out nicely.
Made these for my moms birthday celebration and they were a hit! I'm not a baker and have done little cooking but for me this was easy and fun.
I topped one loaf with toasted walnuts and the other with Skor bits. Very good!
I love this recipe! The 4 picky kid w love it. I made it abs brought some to work and everyone keeps asking for it for every potluck lol
I only had 2 cups of sugar for this recipe but it was still good.
Delicious! I substituted Gluten free flour for regualr flour. I used "Namaste organic Gluten free flour blend." I also added about a cup of walnuts! My daughter and I love this recipe! :-)

The bread was extremely moist, but could be a bit sweeter with more spice. My husband loved it the way it was though. I substituted 3/8 cup Greek yogurt for half the oil (1/2 cup) to reduce the fat. Even with the substitution, the bread was really moist.
I love this recipe! It makes a lot, so I usually end up making some muffins and a few loaves of the bread with it. Great flavor, very most... everyone in the family loved it!!
This recipe was amazing. To make it healthier, I replaced the oil with a cup of unsweetened applesauce and I used 1 cup of brown sugar and 1 cup regular sugar instead. Moist, delicious and less fat!
This is a great pumpkin bread
This recipe is so easy to make and delicious. I did add an extra tsp of cinnamon and nutmeg. It turned out great.
